thread.title: Tony’s Tastes: Impress guests with standing rib roast
thread.title_full: Tony’s Tastes: Impress guests with standing rib roast

title: Tony’s Tastes: Impress guests with standing rib roast
text:
Tony’s Tastes: Impress guests with standing rib roast Tony Giberson, pnj.com 4:45 p.m. CDT October 13, 2015 Take a break from the traditional, boring holiday dinner fare and serve standing rib roast to your family, friends and other holiday guests. (Photo: Tony Giberson/tgiberson@pnj.com) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
With the holiday season fast approaching, you may find yourself entertaining family and friends. If such occasion arises and you find yourself in need of a simple yet memorable dinner solution your visitors will rave about, serve them a standing rib roast. 
Five simple ingredients — the roast, garlic, Kosher salt, coarse ground pepper and olive oil — combine to turn the top cut of beef into something exceptional, and oddly enough, while expensive, you may find it cheaper than lesser cuts of beef. 
Look for this story on pnj.com, where this month’s episode of Tony’s Tastes will walk you through the process, step by step. No need to take notes, though: For your convenience, the recipe is printed here. Enjoy! 
Standing Rib Roast 
1- or 2-bone Standing Rib Roast 
Kosher salt
